result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Vernell Wyatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aaron Vernell Wyatt

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Case Letter

10:12 AM Defendant Aaron Vernell Wyatt in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Aaron Vernell Wyatt.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will plead to sole count. $50 plus costs, 1 day jail, 1 credit.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by plea. Defendant understands. Court finds defendant understands proceedings and finds waiver made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. Court accepts plea and finds plea is knowingly, freely and voluntarily made. Stipulation to a factual basis. Court finds defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered.
Court orders $50 fine plus costs, 1 day jail, 1 days credit. Bail applied. 60 days to pay balance.

10:13 AM Defendant Aaron Vernell Wyatt in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has not made an offer in the case yet. State requests another status conference. Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
02:13 PM Defendant Aaron Vernell Wyatt in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Address on complaint is confirmed; attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. NG plea entered;
Defendant states he did not get notice of the hearing
Atty Hoffman-citation had a different date on them; defendant shows the State his citations
State request 250.00 cash bail; he is on extended supervision; history out of Washburn County and Barron County; failures to appear; probation that was revoked; citations that were given were trailing citations; he was given sufficient notice of 1/5/22 date on bail receipt 
Atty Hoffman-resides here in Superior; currently employed at Holiday Inn; he has no money to post; request high signature bond
Court-orders 400.00 cash bail; 6-7 failures to appear and he is on extended supervision; probation violations and revocations; court also orders 600.00 signature bond.  No special conditions.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:02 PM Defendant Aaron Vernell Wyatt not in court.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant did not appear in Court and State requests warrant to be issued. Court orders warrant.
